page.title: 01 Landscape.
page.content: The countryside around Bruton is very beautiful and peaceful.There are many farms dotted here and there that make the countryside seem much prettier. The two woods,Pink Wood and Cogley Wood are different,Pink Wood is coniferous and Cogley Wood is dominantly deciduous.The River Brue twists silently beside the railway track which leads to Bruton. There are many flowers which light up the hedges and fields.The farmland is used for rough grazing,pasture and some crops.There are marvellous views of fields,hills,streams,valleys and farms. There is a dam (which is part of the flood relief scheme)to lead the water onto another course and prevent flooding. We are lucky to live in this area.
